decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to put pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Fleecemane Lion, Siege Rhino, and Den Protector. This strategy is supported by powerful removal spells like Hero's Downfall and Dromoka's Command, as well as card advantage engines like Whisperwood Elemental and Courser of Kruphix. Additionally, the deck includes efficient removal options like Ultimate Price and Bile Blight to deal with opposing threats. Overall, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of threats and disruption to secure a victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures such as Siege Rhino and Courser of Kruphix to apply pressure on the opponent early in the game. It also includes control elements like Hero's Downfall and Crux of Fate to deal with threats and maintain board presence. The deck has a mix of graveyard recursion with cards like Den Protector and Whip of Erebos, as well as card advantage through card draw spells like Dig Through Time. The mana base includes lands that provide all the necessary colors for the deck's spells and abilities.

This Abzan Aggro deck focuses on early game aggression and pressure through efficient creatures like Fleecemane Lion and Rakshasa Deathdealer. It also utilizes powerful cards like Siege Rhino and Anafenza, the Foremost to maintain board presence and pressure the opponent. The deck includes removal spells like Hero's Downfall and Dromoka's Command to deal with threats and protect its creatures. The mana base ensures consistency in casting spells and provides flexibility with access to all three colors of the Abzan wedge.

The deck focuses on a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing powerful creatures like Siege Rhino and Anafenza, the Foremost to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It also incorporates strong removal spells like Hero's Downfall and Thoughtseize to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck's mana base is carefully crafted to ensure consistency and enable the smooth deployment of threats. Overall, the deck aims to apply early pressure, maintain board presence, and finish off the opponent efficiently.

This deck focuses on using efficient creatures and removal spells to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. By playing powerful threats like Siege Rhino and Elspeth, Sun's Champion, and using disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Abzan Charm, the deck aims to quickly deplete the opponent's resources and finish the game before they can recover. With a mix of resilient creatures and removal spells, the deck is able to adapt to different matchups and maintain its aggressive game plan throughout the match.

This Abzan Aggro deck focuses on fast and aggressive creature plays combined with powerful removal and combat tricks to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck utilizes efficient creatures like Fleecemane Lion and Siege Rhino, alongside versatile spells like Abzan Charm and Hero's Downfall to control the board and deal damage. The inclusion of cards like Warden of the First Tree and Surrak, the Hunt Caller provide additional threats and resilience. The balance of creatures, removal, and combat tricks allows the deck to maintain pressure and adapt to different matchups effectively.

The deck focuses on applying early pressure and maintaining board presence with efficient, aggressive creatures like Fleecemane Lion, Rakshasa Deathdealer, and Anafenza, the Foremost. It aims to finish off opponents quickly with powerful finishers like Siege Rhino and Wingmate Roc. The deck also includes a mix of removal spells like Hero's Downfall and Dromoka's Command to control the board and protect its threats. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive game plan while ensuring consistency in casting spells of all three Abzan colors.

This Abzan Aggro deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures with powerful abilities to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By controlling the board with removal spells such as Hero's Downfall and Dromoka's Command, while boosting your own creatures with cards like Anafenza, the Foremost and Surrak, the Hunt Caller, the deck aims to establish a dominant presence on the battlefield. The inclusion of powerful creatures like Siege Rhino and Warden of the First Tree ensures that the deck can deal consistent damage while maintaining a strong defensive line.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly develop a strong board presence through efficient creatures like Fleecemane Lion and Den Protector, while also maintaining consistency with ramp options like Elvish Mystic and Sylvan Caryatid. By utilizing cards like Deathmist Raptor and Mastery of the Unseen, the deck aims to generate additional value and card advantage. With a mix of removal spells like Dromoka's Command and Valorous Stance, as well as powerful finishers like Dragonlord Ojutai and Surrak, the Hunt Caller, this deck can apply pressure and close out games quickly.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana through mana dorks and Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx, in order to play big threats like Dragonlord Atarka and Polukranos, World Eater. It also aims to generate card advantage and board presence with cards like Whisperwood Elemental and Courser of Kruphix. The deck focuses on controlling the game by ramping up mana to play powerful threats and disrupting the opponent's strategy through its control elements.

The focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up resources with mana-producing creatures and land cards, allowing for powerful, high-cost creatures to be played ahead of schedule. The goal is to control the board and overwhelm opponents with large creatures such as Dragonlord Atarka and Polukranos, World Eater. The use of cards like Whisperwood Elementals and Courser of Kruphix provide card advantage, while See the Unwritten allows for even more powerful creatures to be summoned. With a mix of acceleration and powerful threats, this deck aims to dominate the late game.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats, and generating card advantage through card draw and selection. It includes a mix of dragons for finishers, removal spells to handle threats, and counter spells to disrupt the opponent's plans. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements, with a mix of painlands, scry lands, and fetch lands to ensure consistency in casting spells. Overall, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and win through attrition and card advantage.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on using efficient creatures such as Courser of Kruphix and Sylvan Caryatid to ramp up mana and gain card advantage. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Thoughtseize and removal spells like Murderous Cut and Hero's Downfall. The deck's win conditions include cards like Whip of Erebos and Hornet Queen, providing life gain and evasive threats. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and powerful spells, while also maintaining card advantage and flexibility through cards like Den Protector and Sidisi, Undead Vizier.

The main concept of this Aggro Red Deck Wins archetype is to overwhelm the opponent with an aggressive onslaught of cheap and efficient creatures, backed up by a variety of burn spells to clear the way and finish off the opponent. The deck focuses on quickly building a wide board presence to deal damage as fast as possible, utilizing powerful pump spells like Atarka's Command and Become Immense to push through for lethal damage. The deck aims to finish the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize and mount a defense.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a swarm of small, aggressive creatures. By utilizing cards like Foundry Street Denizen and Monastery Swiftspear to buff up your creatures, combined with burn spells like Lightning Strike and Stoke the Flames to clear the way, the goal is to deal damage as fast as possible and finish off the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of Atarka's Command provides additional reach and flexibility in dealing damage. It's all about going all out and taking the opponent by surprise with a relentless barrage of attacks.

The deck focuses on aggressive plays and quick damage output, utilizing low mana cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Zurgo Bellstriker, and Lightning Berserker to apply pressure early on. It also includes spells like Atarka's Command, Wild Slash, and Lightning Strike for additional damage and removal. Dragon Fodder and Hordeling Outburst help generate tokens for extra damage and can be buffed by cards like Goblin Rabblemaster. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently with a combination of creatures, burn spells, and token generation.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly and using powerful dragons and burn spells to overwhelm the opponent. The deck runs a mix of mana acceleration cards like Elvish Mystic and Courser of Kruphix alongside big threats like Stormbreath Dragon and Thunderbreak Regent. The goal is to get ahead on board presence early and maintain pressure with aggressive creatures and direct damage spells. Xenagos, the Reveler helps generate additional mana for big plays, while cards like Crater's Claws and Draconic Roar provide additional reach to finish off the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells in the early game, while maintaining a strong board presence and finishing off the opponent with powerful dragons in the late game. By using mana ramp from cards like Elvish Mystic and Rattleclaw Mystic, the deck aims to quickly play its threats and apply pressure on the opponent. In addition, the inclusion of cards like Thunderbreak Regent and Stormbreath Dragon provides a strong flying presence that can be difficult for opponents to deal with.

The main idea of this deck is to assemble the Jeskai Ascendancy combo as quickly as possible. To do this, the deck utilizes cards like Retraction Helix, Briber's Purse, and Altar of the Brood to generate mana and dig through the deck for key pieces. The deck also includes defensive cards like Sylvan Caryatid and Nyx-Fleece Ram to buy time until the combo is ready. By efficiently cycling through the deck and generating mana, the deck aims to win the game by either milling the opponent out with Altar of the Brood or overwhelming them with a huge creature.

The deck focuses on utilizing Jeskai Ascendancy to trigger a combo with cards like Retraction Helix and Altar of the Brood to generate infinite mana and mill the opponent's deck. It includes cards like Rattleclaw Mystic, Sylvan Caryatid, and Voyaging Satyr to ramp up and fix mana, while also running card draw and selection spells like Dig Through Time and Anticipate to find combo pieces. Briber's Purse provides interaction and protection, allowing the deck to set up and execute its combo efficiently.

The main focus of this deck is to play aggressively and quickly overwhelm the opponent with a variety of creatures and spells. By combining powerful creatures like Mantis Rider and Stormbreath Dragon with burn spells like Stoke the Flames and Lightning Strike, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The inclusion of cards like Treasure Cruise and Dig Through Time help maintain card advantage and ensure a steady stream of threats. Overall, the deck is designed to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain momentum throughout the game.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with cards like Seeker of the Way and Hordeling Outburst, while using burn spells like Wild Slash and Stoke the Flames to control the board and finish off opponents. Jeskai Ascendancy provides a powerful boost to your creatures, while cards like Narset Transcendent and Treasure Cruise offer card advantage and additional utility. By combining efficient creatures with burn spells and card draw, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a steady stream of threats and removal.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence using cheap token creatures like Dragon Fodder, Hordeling Outburst, and Raise the Alarm, and then enhance them with Jeskai Ascendancy to pump them up and generate card advantage with cards like Treasure Cruise. The deck also includes burn spells like Wild Slash and Stoke the Flames for removal and reach. Monastery Mentor and Soulfire Grand Master provide additional value and synergies with the rest of the deck, creating a fast and aggressive playstyle.

This deck focuses on maintaining a fast and aggressive playstyle, overwhelming opponents with a combination of low-cost creatures and burn spells. By consistently pressuring the opponent with early creatures like Bloodsoaked Champion and Zurgo Bellstriker, and supporting them with powerful cards like Goblin Rabblemaster and Brutal Hordechief, the deck aims to finish the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Tymaret, the Murder King and Blood-Chin Fanatic provide additional reach and ways to close out games efficiently.

The deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy, utilizing low-cost creatures like Goblin Heelcutter and Mardu Scout to quickly deal damage. The aim is to flood the board with creatures and use burn spells like Lightning Strike and Stoke the Flames to finish off the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel punishes opponents for playing spells, adding to the pressure of the deck. Overall, the deck aims to win the game quickly and decisively through a combination of creature aggression and direct damage.

This deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures, burn spells, and creature tokens. By quickly building a board presence and dealing damage directly to the opponent, it aims to end the game swiftly before the opponent can stabilize or mount a defense. Cards like Monastery Swiftspear, Lightning Berserker, and Hordeling Outburst help to quickly establish a threatening board presence, while burn spells like Lightning Strike and Wild Slash provide additional reach to finish off the opponent. Overall, the deck prioritizes speed and aggression to secure victories.

The deck focuses on maintaining a fast-paced offensive strategy, using efficient burn spells and cheap creature spells to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. Cards like Searing Blood, Wild Slash, and Lightning Strike provide direct damage to keep pressure on the opponent, while cards like Dragon Fodder and Foundry Street Denizen help build a wide board presence. Additional threats like Goblin Rabblemaster and Thunderbreak Regent can provide extra damage and disruption. Overall, the deck is designed to win the game as quickly as possible through aggressive creature-based attacks and burn spells.

The deck focuses on quickly playing powerful creatures and planeswalkers to overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes mana ramp cards like Sylvan Caryatid and Rattleclaw Mystic to quickly cast high-cost threats like Dragonlord Atarka and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. The deck also includes versatile removal spells like Roast and Dig Through Time to control the board. The combination of aggressive creatures like Savage Knuckleblade and resilient threats like Ashcloud Phoenix make it difficult for opponents to keep up with the constant pressure. Overall, the deck aims to win the game quickly through continuous aggression and powerful threats.

The deck focuses on using a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and hand disruption to control the game and out-value the opponent. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Dragonlord Silumgar to close out the game once the opponent's resources have been depleted. The mana base is designed to support the deck's heavy blue and black mana requirements, ensuring that the player can consistently cast their spells and control the game from start to finish.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers to disrupt the opponent's strategy. It includes a mix of creature removal, card draw, and disruptive elements such as Thoughtseize and Silumgar's Scorn to maintain board control. The win condition is to outvalue the opponent with powerful late-game threats like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Dragonlord Silumgar, while keeping the opponent's threats in check. The deck also includes efficient card draw spells like Dig Through Time to ensure consistency and flexibility in its game plan.
